IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDescription: HOPE NETWORK FOUNDATION IS A CHRISTIAN ORGANIZATION THAT EMPOWERS PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES OR DISADVANTAGES TO ACHIEVE THEIR HIGHEST LEVEL OF INDEPENDENCE.
IRS990.Description: THE FOUNDATION RAISES FUNDS AND INCREASES THE VISIBILITY OF HOPE NETWORK IN THE COMMUNITIES SERVED THROUGH VARIOUS METHODS INCLUDING CAPITAL CAMPAIGNS, EVENTS, DIRECT MAIL, GRANT WRITING, AND GIFT PLANNING.

Activity2.Description: THE FOUNDATION IS THE TRUSTEE OF THE POOLED ACCOUNTS TRUST. THIS TRUST PROVIDES A MEANS FOR THOSE WITH DISABILITIES TO SELF-FUND THEIR OWN TRUST USING THE FOUNDATION AS THEIR TRUSTEE.

InvestmentsProgramRelated.Description: INVESTMENTS HELD FOR THE BENEFIT OF HOPE

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.ReturnReference: Description of Uncertain Tax Positions Under FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: Effective October 1, 2009, the Foundation adopted Financial Accounting Standards Board (FASB) provisions related to accounting for uncertainty in income taxes, which clarifies the accounting and reporting for uncertainties in income tax law. The provisions prescribe a comprehensive model for the financial statement recognition, measurement, presentation and disclosure of uncertain tax positions taken or expected to be taken in income tax returns. There was no impact on the financial statements upon adopting these provisions.
INVESTMENT EARNINGS TO SUPPORTED ENTITY PER SFAS 136: 30144. INVESTMENT FEES TO SUPPORTED ENTITY PER SFAS 136: 14034.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: Procedure for Monitoring Grants in the U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: Schedule I, Part I, Line 2: HOPE NETWORK FOUNDATION WORKS CLOSELY WITH THE ACCOUNTING STAFF OF THE GRANTEES TO MONITOR GIFTS. THE FOUNDATION TRACKS GIFTS IN ITS OWN DATABASE AND RECONCILES MONTHLY WITH EACH GRANTEES' ACCOUNTING STAFF. THE FOUNDATION'S EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR APPROVES ALL GRANTS. THE FOUNDATION'S GRANT PROGRAM OFFICER WORKS TO ASSURE COMPLIANCE WITH GRANTS TO OTHER ORGANIZATIONS. THIS POSITION HELPS WITH THE CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT OF GRANT MANAGEMENT, AS WELL AS TRACKING AND REPORTING THE USE OF FUNDS.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: WILBUR LETTINGA (DIRECTOR) AND MICHAEL LETTINGA (TREASURER) ARE IMMEDIATE FAMILY MEMBERS AND OFFICERS OF THE LETTINGA FAMILY OWNED KENTLAND CORPORATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 7a
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FOUNDATION'S ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION, THREE DIRECTORS ARE APPOINTED BY HOPE NETWORK AND AFFILIATES.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: 990 IS REVIEWED BY A NUMBER OF LEVELS OF MANAGEMENT, INCLUDING THE PERSON SIGNING THE FORM.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: CONFLICT OF INTEREST FORMS ARE COMPLETED BY ALL BOARD MEMBERS ANNUALLY. MANAGEMENT COMPLETES THE FORM AT HIRING AND IT IS PERIODICALLY UPDATED.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: REVIEW IS PERFORMED BY 2 INDEPENDENT OUTSIDE CONSULTANTS AS WELL AS AN INTERNAL STUDY AND IS ALSO PROVIDED TO THE BOARD.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: HOPE NETWORK FOUNDATION MAKES DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE AS REQUIRED BY LAW. PAPER COPIES ARE PROVIDED UPON REQUEST PRESENTED IN PERSON AT THE HOPE NETWORK LEADERSHIP CENTER.
AS IN PRIOR YEARS, THE FINANCE COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENT REPORTS WITH A GROUP OF MANAGEMENT STAFF.
